This section introduces our five priorities for adult social care in Barnet, which 
build on our four pillars of prevention, co-production, choice & control, and 
equality. These priorities have been written based on co-production with residents 
and staff, data and information, and wider trends in adult social care. 
The five priorities are:
1 We will support people to live well and be part of communities.
2 We will be ambitious about what people can achieve and get the right support 
for each individual.
3 We will work with people to shape and develop care and support.
4 We will work towards more equal access and more inclusive services.
5 We will be realistic in how we use resources, keeping up with changes and ways 
of working, and being creative with finding solutions.

The current budget allocation for Adult Social Care in Barnet is **£135.8 million for the 2023/24 financial year**.

- This allocation is part of Barnet Council's total net revenue budget of £296.6 million, with 46% dedicated to adult social care.
- The budget aims to address the increasing complexity of needs and financial challenges within the sector, ensuring efficient use of resources to meet people's needs and improve access.

For more detailed information or updates, you can visit the Barnet Council's official website at [https://www.barnet.gov.uk](https://www.barnet.gov.uk).
